I explained to her what spring roll is.  After that she told me it will take 10 minutes.  Asked her if she needs my name over the phone, she said no I have your number, which was awkward to say the least.  I arrived there to pick up my order, order was right, orders are delicious.  Managers need to train there employees there much better for service and how to take orders better over the phone.  That is why this place got a 4 out 5 stars
Tom yum soup, pad see yew, and curry. I always order these plates when I come here and it's so good. The waiters are nice and its really really clean.

I came in here with some coworkers for lunch. The lunch special price is pretty good, but too good to be true (at least quality-wise). The price is cheap because you get what you pay for. I got pad Thai to play it safe, and it was mediocre at best. I ate half and took the rest home because the portions are actually pretty big. But it's something you may not want to eat again later. The bottom of my plate had a pool of oil. A few of my coworkers got the curry, which the waiter told me was very popular and seemed to be trying to steer me into getting that. But when I saw their plates it had oil pools on top of the curry. Pretty gross. 

The decor and ambiance are not any better. The whole place looks like it just needs to be scrubbed down. Everything just looks dingy and oily. Even the menus where disgusting and dirty looking. If you give me a dirty menu, which is one of the main things I'm looking it when ordering, then I question the cleanliness of the kitchen, which I can't see. 

I was forced to come here by a coworker, and I'd been putting it off for a while because I'd heard how gross it was. But this coworker was insistent that I would like the price and the food. But alas, he was very wrong and everyone else was very right. I would not touch this place if I was starving and there was nothing else to eat. First it needs to be cleaned, maybe even gutted then cleaned, and the food doesn't need to be covered in oil, then maybe I'd consider going back. They are there to provide bad quality food that tastes mediocre at cheap prices. If that's what you're looking for then this is your place. But it's definitely not for me.

This place is ok...I was with a friend and we were out shopping and got hungry so we stopped in here.  The service was really good, they seated us quickly, came to take our drink orders and then came back to take the food order.

The food was not bad, everything was prepared the way we desired and staff was very friendly and helpful.

We had 3 different dishes and based on those 3 I would venture to say just about anything you get here will be pretty decent.  I would definitely go back to this place again when in the area as I love Chinese, Thai Food and just cannot seem to get enough of it but all places are not the same.

This place is one of the better one's at least based on this experience, we will see next time, I hope they continue to please.

The service is outstanding! never had a bad
Meal & my favorite is the tempura & the TomYum
Soup!! I have been visiting this restaurant for
Years!!

This is my personal favorite Thai spot. It may not look pretty, but don't judge a book by its cover. They do some amazing work back in the kitchen. Food is flavorful and perfected each and every time. I am never disappointed. It's inexpensive and there is so much food. Try out the lettuce and chicken wraps. They are delicious!

First time eating here, my boyfriend and I absolutely loved it! We had the Lunch Special (from Mon- Fri 11am-3pm) and everything was delicious for a very good price. Also the service was very friendly. I had the shrimp with the number 40 (rice noodles with soy souce and veggies) and it comes with a small soup or salad and an egg roll. We will definitely come back!!

I recently had a very disappointing meal delivered from here--1 star since delivery was fast. I ordered egg rolls which were good (additional star), but my pad thai was not even close to tasting even semi-authentic--it was red colored (never seen such red colored pad thai before) and consisted of very dry stuck together noodles with absolutely no flavor. The wonton soup I ordered did have a ton of chicken in it, but the wontons were so soggy they pretty much fell apart the second my spoon touched them and the soup was soooooo bland.

I have to be honest ... I use to really love this place but last couple of times I went ... the chicken tasted recooked and not at all fresh... eh kinda saddens me ... case they have the best dam curry ive ever tried !!!they need to up there grade in beef and chicken ... I use to come here alot ... but ever since then I stoped case no one wants to eat left over recooked tough chicken ... :,( I hope they can learn off this ... before then I gave it a perfect 5 .... only reason im ratein it lower is in hopes they never compromise again ...
The food was delicious. We came here after reading comments on Yelp and so glad we did. The Tom Yum Soup was really great!

I always enjoy eating here because their service is always good. They always ask how you are doing and if everything is good with the food. Their food comes out pretty quick and I usually order panang chicken. I also recommend eating their honey walnut shrimp and pad Thai, it's so delicious.

Yellow Curry is good. It doesn't always taste the same but most of the time it's decent.
It's not one of the best Thai places I've been to but I don't think Thai is their specialty.

I just like yellow curry mostly. I ordered a soup, I think a seafood soup here. It was not something I would ever order again but someone else might like it. 

The food isn't bad it just isn't really special. I would call it mediocre or average for Chinese and Thai. That's why Im giving 3 stars. 

One thing I will say is the portion is quite large. I don't think I've ever finished the curry in one sitting but at the price you pay for how average it tastes you should atleast get a large portion. 

The staff are nice. Anytime I've ever interacted with them they've been kind and always offer me a water when I'm waiting to pick up. 

If you just wanna grab something to eat real quick it's not a bad place. Just don't expect it to blow your mind if you are looking to try something new. I just like curry and it's down the street. When I don't feel like driving far for the good Thai places I'll just grab a curry here real quick.

Much better than I expected.  The service when we visited was very attentive.  I wasn't feeling the lunch menu much but they let me order from the dinner menu.  

We had steamed veggie dumplings, deep fried strip beef and deep fried strip chicken.  I loved those dumplings and the sauces on the entrees were excellent.

Good food, good prices and good service.  I definitely have to come back here and check out some of the other selections.

Love this little place! The food is consistently good and the service is always very attentive and friendly.  We've never had a bad experience.  They have a comfortable atmosphere, reasonable prices... all the things we hope for in our quick lunch-stop restaurants.  

We usually order the Crab Rangoons to start, which are very good in comparison with a lot of other places.  I get the Chicken Krung Prow often and enjoy the spicy kick it has, while my husband explores the menu ordering something different every time, and seems to never have anything negative to say about any of his dishes.  Rice is, of course, included, and our drinks have not ever run out before someone is swooping in with a refill.

Honestly, the food could be half as good and we'd still make regular stops based on the service alone.  You are really taken care of here!

I found a cooked up roach in my food! GROSSE!

too bad cause the ambient is good.. but I go out to eat mainly for the food.

02/15/11 DINNER. ONLY DID DELIVERY, SO SERVICE NOT REVIEWED. 

Hot & sour soup quite good, filled with lots of stuff. Crabmeat fried rice good, not great. Panang duck was good, spicy, but not much flavor in duck. (Guess can't complain for the price, under $10.) Spicy noodle, with chicken, shrimp AND squid, was outstanding. In every dish we asked for spicy, VERY spicy, where appropriate, and we got spicy. Final price tag was HIGHER than advertised on website, even factoring in tax, so either they've raised prices OR they are indeed charging for delivery (even tho website says free with $15 purchase). Overall, some really good thai food, but nothing to go out of the way for.

I decided to stop here because it was sort of close by and I have passed it a million times. 

Im glad I stopped by. 

Again I know Im in the right place with Im surrounded by Asian patrons. I had the lunch special which was 5.99. 

The soup was rich and flavorful for chicken soup. 

I had the cashew nut delight with squid and it was really delicious. 

The thai iced  tea was great. I have never had it before and was pleasantly surprised.

I will be back

Finally after 6 months of searching (with no luck) for an honest Chinese place that we can frequent, we have  found this place. Its a small, very clean, with amazing service and staff. The food is reallllly good and generous portions at a more than reasonable price. We were starting to think it was too much to ask for a neighborhood Chinese restaurant that we can frequent once a week or so. thrilled to have found Bangkok 9!!!!

I love this place! The food is always so delicious and comes out quick! Our waitress always remembers our order and is very friendly :) I highly suggest checking this place out if you like Thai food, the menu has so much to pick from! (I suggest the chicken pad see oew mmm)

Terrific little strip-mall restaurant, run by friendly people, and most importantly -- everyone loved their dinners!  We go with friends on Friday nights, and a few people order the eggplant (which normally I hate, but this one's pretty good.)  For me, the Mango Chicken has a wonderful sweet taste and the chicken stays crispy.  Same for the Orange Beef  -- crunchy till the end (previously called the Bangkok 9 Beef, or the Strip Beef.)  I do not like the Pad Thai, too fishy.  But my friend loved the fish filet, and used rice to soak up all the tasty juices off the plate.  The lettuce wraps were ok ... but nothing better than I make at home, def not better than PF Changs, my go-to for lettuce cups.

I love this place. I have been coming a long time and it has always been great. My husband likes spicy, so he goes for those kind of dishes. I like not spicy, so I go for the assorted vegetable with chicken. Great sauce, great prices.

We ordered to go, and the food was not great. We will not eat here again.
 We ordered the red curry chicken. It was watered down like soup, and other than the hot chile, there wasn't much flavor in it.  We ordered the chicken satay. My 6 year old said," How am I supposed to eat this, it is so hard?" It was so hard and dry she couldn't even bite into it. We ordered the ginger chicken- again watery broth and you couldn't even taste the ginger.
I've never had bad food from here. It's always amazing and their service is great! They've even fixed in order that I messed up with no fuss at all!

This has been my go to Thai Resturant for years. Although I have never came to Yelp this place because it was my secret hidden gem for Pad Thai and their Thai Tea. This is a go to Thai Resturant if you are in the area!
Great prices and excellent customer service, but flavors just weren't there for me. Enjoyed the fried rice but was disappointed in their curry and papaya salad :-(.
Second time around. Tum Yum soup is the best here. And best Thai iced tea. Service is good. Always get seated right away.
Great food and great prices!! My favorite is the green curry.

Went here for Christmas Eve and the people are very nice and polite. I ordered a lot of food to-go and the food was really good. My favorite was the salt and pepper pork chop, and the egg rolls. One of the workers (maybe he was the owner) asked me how many people are going to be eating and I told him about 10, and he ended up giving me 10 free egg rolls. He also helped us get the food in my car. I don't usually get a lot of customer service from asian restaurants, so I was surprised with this restaurant. I'm definitely going to be coming back.

I was hoping to find another good Thai place. Nope, not this place. I did love that we could order completely online and pick it up, but my love stops there.

I ordered the Spicy Noodle that came with chicken, shrimp and squid. The squid was more like a squid version of a chicken nugget! The chicken was sooo dry and it had like 2 shrimp. The flavor was spicy, but not a flavorful spicy. I will say that the noodles were nice and done. It also had no sauce at all. 

My Mom ordered the Mongolian Chicken. In ordering online I put in the notes that her's was not be very spicy. Wow, her's was spicier then mine and the chicken was soooo dry! 

My husband got the Pad See Oiw with pork. His lacked flavor as well and had very dry pork. If his had the sauce it was supposed to have it at least would have been bearable.

Overall, I will say the portion size was nice, but it wasn't tasty so that really didn't matter. 

I'll stick with other places that I know are good. Meh explains it ALL!
Always delicious. Always prompt. Can't go wrong with this place. The pad see ew and the fried rice is the best!!!
Not only is the food delicious, the staff are so nice and welcoming. I enjoying dining in or ordering to go from an establishment that has amazing customer service.
Good and clean Thai food with a family atmosphere. These are good cooks and super sweet service staff. This is a fabulous, little, hole in the wall in Henderson.

We found this place about 2 yrs ago when we moved to the area and my fam n I love going for lunch. It's fast, clean, great service and the food is delicious at reasonable price. You're gonna fall in love with this place just as we did

Awwwwwkay! Where do I start ? Mm oh yeah after we ordered we got this mee Krob that I thought was just for us to chow down but to find out it actually serves double purpose first you play a game and it's like playing where's Waldo. Now, the tofu on this mee Krob will play Waldo ... Keep digging, keep stirring in this mountain of fried colored red fried noodle and you might get a price if you find the tofu. Dang Bro! Talking about needle on a haystack. Well I gave up. I just went for it and i still didn't get justice in my noodles...it tasted like a fried noodle with sweet chili sauce. I say hey " should have ordered lumpia with this". Tea ? Mmmm it's like "give this people tea from the bag we used earlier it will still work ". Sigh ! Can't taste nothing . It's cool tho' I put some generic Splenda on that tea and " Boy Behold" it tasted better. Panang Curry ? It's like coconut chicken only but since it's Thai restaurant it can be Panang. Hey it works ! Be happy, find out on your own. It could just me :) it could be good on your taste bud. !

Despite the low-star rating, this may be a place you want to try.  Chinese can be a real preference driven food, and there are other people here who really enjoyed Bangkok 9, and the place it run by extremely friendly people.  Also note, I had the Chinese, not the Thai food, so you may experience something different.

Our order contained a couple Sweet & Sour dishes, and they did not come breaded.  Also, their egg rolls are more like spring rolls.

Food is good for the price. Had the Crab Meat Fried Rice and Pad Thai. Pad Thai is bright pink and pretty tasteful. First time I've seen crab meat fried rice, pretty decent. Probably will return since it's close to my job.

Oh Bangkok 9.
I miss living around the corner  from you.

Every time I've ordered or dined in here, I've had great service, and great food.

The Golden Bags are a revelation.
I love curry...my favorites are the yellow, the panang, and the masaman.  

I'm going to have to go back soon, I'm craving good curry!
Awesome food! One of our favorite spots :-). The Chef's fried rice and bbq chicken is phenomenal.
4 stars because they are always consistent. Food is good, not the best I've ever had but for the price you can't beat it.

I usually come here during my lunch break. 11-3pm. It starts at 5.95. More for shrimp. 
1. Red curry chicken
2. Green curry chicken 
3. Panang curry beef 
4. Eggplant tofu 
5. Pad see ew 
Lunches come with egg drop soup, white rice, and fried egg roll

- Fast service. Food ready within 5-10min. It's not too hectic where it will take longer than an hour to eat. I'm usually in and out in 30 minutes. 
- Curry is pretty good, but thin. needs more spice. 
- Eggplant tofu, not enough eggplant. 
- Chinese broccoli not in Pad see ew. Regular broccoli.
- Beef and chicken are tender. 
- Left over spice rack.
- I feel that food is already made, just microwaved? Not too fresh?
- Quality is not the best, but for lunch, I rank this place great! Satifying for what it's worth.
Great Thai Food!!! Awesome service and prices are great! One of the best places for Thai I've been to hands down. Pad Thai is the bomb!

Been coming here for years. Lemme keep it simple, simply the best Thai ever. We always try other places and keep coming back here.

Plus the prices and service are amazing!!

This is our usual spot for Thai food. The staff is friendly and they're really good at remembering their customers. I've seen them start putting in an order as soon as a regular comes in. Customer service is never an issue here. 

The food is always pretty satisfying here. There have been some items I've ordered that were just ok. But, the usual items I order are always delicious and flavorful. The 3 items we order just about every time we're here are the shrimp fried rice, pad Thai, and the Cashew Nut Delight with chicken. The shrimp fried rice has tons of large shrimp and they give you the option to add the tomatoes and onions. The Pad Thai is a good one, though they use a thinner noodle instead of the thicker, wider noodles that are typical of other Pad Thai's. Theirs comes with both chicken and shrimp in a standard order so no need to pay extra for shrimp. The Cashew Nut Delight has a nice balance of flavors and you can adjust the spiciness to your liking. Comes with lots of veggies and, of course, cashews. 

I love the smaller, intimate setting of the restaurant. The service is fast and the staff is attentive. They also have decent lunch specials. I'll keep coming back to get my Thai fix.

Decent Thai and Chinese food. Prices are pretty much on par with similar restaurants. Portions are big enough to be shared with a friend, or save some for later or just pig out now!
Our group of 7 came in for lunch. We were well taken care of, the staff was very nice and accommodating. Some of the dishes we got were Mongolian Beef, Pad Thai, Spicy Noodle, Curry Panang, and Fried Rice. I think the chicken was a bit dry. Shrimp and beef were very good. All the vegetables were fresh and crisp. All the meals had good flavor but minimal spice or heat. You can ask them to kick up the heat or add your own if you like it hot.
I would eat here again.

Recently got delivery for the first time from Bangkok 9. While in person I usually find that their food is just OK, it did not translate well to delivery. The food arrived just bland and underseasoned. Not enjoyable. Have to say the people on the phone and the delivery guy were still super nice though!
Service is always on point and the staff is always humble and welcoming! Love this place!! Feels like family! And the food is always how we ask for!
Amazing place for lunch or dinner. The staff is incredible and the food is even better. One of my many favorites is the thai wraps. I recommend it!!!

My family went here for my birthday yesterday, and we all ordered a variety of dishes - orange chicken, pad thai, "yum tofu" and a side of cream cheese wontons. We were all very impressed by the food, and even had enough to take as leftovers today! The wait staff was great, and was quick to refill our drinks or get us anything we needed. I look forward to returning here, and trying out a new dish.

This is my go to place for Pad Thai. I usually call in ahead of time for a to go order and I'm always greeted with a friendly person. The to-go serving size is generous to say the least. You can choose a slickness level and they give you and extra portion of hot oil to mix in if you want more spice. The best part about their Pad Thai is that it comes with chicken and shrimp automatically for only $8.95! Flavor, spice, and overall quality of this dish is fantastic for such a low price.
My husband and I have been coming here for 10 years. We love this place itd our go to place. Food is great and the price is even better!

I am such a fan of this place. First off, we came in here once, for like 10 minutes. Ordered the Pad Thai, Original style cooked in sweet and sour sauce. 

Every time we walk in the door, the waitress knows what we want, and how we order it. Now I added Chicken Satay to my order. Sometimes the Pad Thai is clumped together, but nothing a little sriracha cant fix.

Spicy level is from 0-10!

Excellent food and service!  Everything is fresh and tasty.  I love the pork in garlic sauce.  All the appetizers are delightful, but my favorite is the lettuce wrap.  Service is superb.  Once you visit a couple of times, they remember you and even your favorite dish.  Place is beautiful and very clean.  Best Thai in town!

This is a great place to get a cheap lunch that is very filling and quite satisfying for the taste buds! Lunch specials are $5.95, and it comes with soup or salad and an egg roll with your main entree. You can get many entrees like Pad Thai, Yellow Curry, Mongolian Beef, etc. with your lunch special. Not too bad for a local Thai place...

The lunch special is only available Monday-Friday. The restaurant is open 7 days a week. Lunch is 11am-3pm, and Dinner is 3pm-10pm.

Literally the worst pad thai ever. Something must've gone wrong because my pad thai doesn't even look like the pictures posted on here. Mine is bland and tastes like they mixed some sweet and sour sauce in just to get a reddish color.

Please do not go here! I went here today to just try it out and I'm sorry I did... This place needs a health inspector asap! A roach crawled out from behind our booth we were sitting at.....when I look behind the booth, all I see is rotting food and trash. I think I saw mice poop too:O

Love the panang curry chicken! The kra prow is really good too. Went today for some quick takeout and the service is friendly and fast. I was even asked if I wanted water while I waited.

Prices are reasonable and the portions are pretty large by today's standards. Most dishes come with rice and you choose the level of spice you want. Beware the hot stuff! Even the mild spicy has a kick to it, but the spicy stuff will knock your socks off! 

I will be back!

Disgusting! Undercooked , dirty , unseasoned food. How this place has any good review is mindblowing. They seem to only care about how fast the food can come out and not the QUALITY of the food. Undercooked wonton's in the soup, dirty mussels in the seafood entree (you can see the dirt hanging off the shell!), zero flavoring in any of the dishes and sour tasting cheese puff (as if it had gone bad). We will NEVER eat there again and certainly will NOT recommend this place to anyone.
Hard to find a good Chinese/Thai place to eat and this place is pretty good! Not the best i have ever had but i definitely was not disappointed. :)

All I can say is, crap... total crap... You folks that gave this "thai" food place 5 stars needs to taste some REAL Thai food.  We ordered papaya salad and it was so sweet, never had that before.  The beef larb was just plain beef w s few pieces of lettuce and some lime juice.  The BBQ chicken was frickin' FRIED, wtf?!?!?!?!   Can't even make Thai tea right either   The glass of water was scrumptious though

I have come here maybe three times randomly over the past 6 years. They haven't changed much, which is good. I remember it being more fancy when I was younger.
It still is a cute restaurant. The service is by far fantastic. The ladies that serve are very nice and probably the best thing about this place. 

The food is ok. I'm less of a meat eater so I don't prefer much of the menu, but they do have really nice shrimp dishes, and I really like the soup! I got the Tom Yum. Sour and spicy, I really enjoyed it. A few too many mushrooms, but it was great. The summer roll was really great and fresh! It had shrimp and cucumber. However the dark sauce they give you for dipping is hideous. Sorry to say its looks like chocolate sauce with nuts on it, and kind of tastes just as sweet. Seemed straight out of a bottle. I used soy sauce instead and it was fine. 

My mom got the eggplant delight with shrimp and tofu. Very good. She  enjoyed it. we also got the veggie rice. Very good as well. 
They introduced me to Tsingtao beer and I'm all about it. Nice and light.


Next time I would like to try pineapple rice. That and the honey walnut shrimp looks amazing.
Everything I order from here tastes fresh and delicious. I usually try the curries and boba, with some kind of soup. I order something new every time, and I am always happy.

Both our dishes were delicious!! Even the $1 size of rice was great haha. The tofu was cooked perfectly and all the sauces used were layered with so many flavors. Great prices too. What really impressed us was the service. Fast, attentive and so polite. You can tell they're customer service focused. Great food delivered fast with a smile!! I also loved that they had salt scrub for your hands to sample in the bathroom.  :)

I love this place for quick and tasty delivery. Their yellow curry and chicken pad Thai are great, as are their crab Rangoon appetizers. I've been ordering delivery from here for years and they're as friendly as they come.
Love the restaurant, the food, and especially the staff. It's to the point where they already know my takeout phone number and what I love ordering. My absolute favorite restaurant.
